API.ADK

Class API_ADK

  • java.lang.Object
    • API.ADK.API_ADK
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConstantList

    public class API_ADK
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstantList
    This class implements all the functionalities of the ADK and should be called by an application that wants to connect and communicate with a CAN device. Call createAPI_ADKObject() to create the object of this class and then call initializeADK() to initialize the class. This class uses Driver class and its subclasses internally.
    Author:
    hroesdiyono

      • returnCode

        Global variable for ReturnCode.

      • intDeviceList

        public static volatile DeviceList intDeviceList
        Structure contains list of devices, controllers, message channels, including the name, number of each parts, and their connection status. This structure is used internally and should be filled to be able to use the ADK. It could be filled manually or automatically. To fill it automatically, call searchAvailableDevice(API.ADK.DeviceList) with this structure as its parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • API_ADK

        private API_ADK()
        Private constructor, can only be called from inside the class.

    • Method Detail

      • createAPI_ADKObject

        public static API_ADK createAPI_ADKObject()
        Call this method to create this class object. The object can only be created once. Call initializeADK() directly after this method to be able to use this class. Note that after calling deinitializeADK(), the object becomes unusable and a new object can be created again.
        Returns:
        API_ADK object or null if the object creation fails.

      • getADKVersion

        public java.lang.String getADKVersion()
        Return the version of the ADK.
        Returns:
        The string of the ADK version.

      • getDriverVersion

        public java.lang.String getDriverVersion()
        Return the version of the Driver.
        Returns:
        The string of the Driver version.

      • initializeADK

        public ReturnCode initializeADK()
        Initialize objects and the communication interface. The initialize communication interface is a blocking method, which check whether the communication interface is turned on or not. If it is not turned on, it will be turned on and wait until it is ready to be used. This method should be called first after creating the object, and before calling any other method.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.FAIL_ACCESSING_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.BLUETOOTH_NOT_SUPPORTED, or ReturnCode.FAIL_TURNING_BLUETOOTH_ON.

      • deinitializeADK

        public ReturnCode deinitializeADK()
        Close the communication interface and deinitialize objects. The close communication interface is a blocking method, which turned the communication interface off and waits until it is completely off. This method will only return success if all the connection to the device have been closed. After calling this method, the class object becomes unusable, any other methods will not be executed. Call this method at the end of the application.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.DEVICE_INSTANCE_STILL_OPEN, or ReturnCode.FAIL_TURNING_BLUETOOTH_OFF.

      • searchAvailableDevice

        public ReturnCode searchAvailableDevice(DeviceList supportedDeviceList)
        List for all paired devices, but only return the supported device. Use intDeviceList as the parameter to fill the internal Device List automatically.
        Parameters:
        supportedDeviceList - Output: List of supported devices.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.DEVICELIST_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.MAXIMUM_BYTE_CAPACITY_REACH, ReturnCode.NO_PAIRED_DEVICE, or ReturnCode.NO_SUPPORTED_DEVICE.

      • createDeviceObject

        public API_ADK.Device createDeviceObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Create an object of the Device class. Choose one of the device from the internal Device List. Call API_ADK.Device.connectDevice() directly after this method to connect to the device. Call API_ADK.Device.disconnectDevice() to disconnect from the device and deinitialize the Device object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        API_ADK.Device object or null if it is already created.
